title: Classic Margherita Pizza
description: A simple but delicious traditional Italian pizza with fresh ingredients.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C) with a pizza stone if available.
Stretch the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle.
Spread crushed tomatoes over the dough, leaving a small border.
Tear mozzarella into pieces and distribute over the sauce.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: The perfect classic chocolate chip cookies - crispy edges, chewy centers, and loaded with chocolate.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a small bowl.
Beat butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar in a large mixer bowl.
Add eggs one at a time, then vanilla, beating well.
Gradually beat in flour mixture, then stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes until golden brown.
Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks.

title: Avocado Toast
description: A quick, nutritious breakfast that's endlessly customizable.
instructions: Toast bread until golden and firm.
Cut avocado in half, remove pit, and scoop into a bowl.
Add a squeeze of lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste.
Mash with a fork to desired consistency.
Spread avocado mixture on toast.
Top with red pepper flakes and any optional toppings.

title: Veggie Stir Fry
description: A quick and healthy weeknight dinner packed with vegetables and flavor.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add onion and garlic, stir fry for 1 minute.
Add carrots and bell pepper, cook for 2 minutes.
Add broccoli and snap peas, stir fry for 3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil in a small bowl.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Serve immediately over cooked rice.

title: Homemade Granola
description: Crunchy, customizable granola that's perfect for breakfast or snacking.
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment.
In a large bowl, mix oats, nuts, seeds, cinnamon, and salt.
In a small bowl, whisk together maple syrup, coconut oil, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients over dry and mix thoroughly.
Spread mixture evenly on baking sheet.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes until golden.
Let cool completely, then add dried fruit if desired.
Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

title: Classic Beef Burger
description: Juicy homemade beef burgers that are perfect for grilling season.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt, pepper, and onion powder.
Mix gently with hands until just combined (don't overmix).
Divide into 6 equal portions and shape into patties slightly larger than your buns.
Press a slight indentation in the center of each patty to prevent bulging.
Grill over medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes per side for medium doneness.
If adding cheese, place on top during the last minute of cooking.
Toast buns lightly if desired.
Serve burgers on buns with desired toppings and condiments.

title: Banana Bread
description: A moist, delicious way to use up overripe bananas.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 4x8 inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine mashed bananas and melted butter.
Mix in sugar, egg, and vanilla.
Sprinkle baking soda and salt over the mixture and stir in.
Add flour and mix just until combined.
Fold in walnuts if using.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 55-65 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Caprese Salad
description: A simple Italian salad made with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving platter.
Tuck basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Serve immediately at room temperature.

title: Creamy Tomato Soup
description: A comforting homemade soup that's perfect for cold days.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Stir in heavy cream and basil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, topped with croutons if desired.

title: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: A protein-packed breakfast that's both healthy and delicious.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix Greek yogurt with half of the honey.
In tall glasses or bowls, create layers starting with yogurt.
Add a layer of mixed berries.
Add another layer of yogurt.
Top with granola and sliced almonds.
Drizzle with remaining honey.
Garnish with fresh mint if desired.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours.
